proposals.reasoning: I still want to anchor the first mission around the generally agreed-on stable core of Diana and Grace. Previously I leaned toward adding Bob to that pair so we weren’t over-rewarding the Alice/Charlie quiet-only push, but as mission leader I think including myself is more transparent and gives everyone clearer accountability and reactions to work with. This team keeps the Diana+Grace core most people trust, avoids the early narrative drivers being together, and adds me in a way that should produce useful vote and mission information.

votes.comment: Fits the broadly trusted Diana+Grace core while avoiding stacking the early narrative drivers together; fine as an info-gathering first mission.
Diana+Grace are broadly trusted and Jack’s inclusion avoids over-rewarding the Alice/Charlie quiet-only bloc while giving good early info.

I don’t like locking in Jack on the very first team when most of the table consensus was just on Diana + Grace as a core; I’d rather see a version that tests one of the earlier-mentioned third options instead.
I trust the widely supported Diana+Grace core for Mission 1 and don’t see enough specific reason to doubt Jack yet; this is a reasonable, info-rich starting team.

Diana and Grace are widely trusted, and adding Jack (who’s been measured and not part of the early alignment between Alice/Charlie) gives us a solid first test with good informational value and no obvious red flags.
I still prefer a Diana+Grace core but with Bob or me as the third for clearer info; Jack hasn’t been vetted enough yet and this feels like we’re dodging the earlier tradeoffs instead of testing them.
Diana+Grace is a broadly trusted core, Jack’s inclusion gives useful accountability and there’s no strong reason yet to suspect this mix for Mission 1.
Diana+Grace are widely trusted, and adding Jack instead of an early narrative driver (Alice/Charlie/Bob/Frank) is a reasonable, informative first mission lineup.
Diana + Grace have broad trust, and including Jack as leader gives us clean early info without overfitting to the Alice/Charlie dynamic yet.
I want to be on the first team for sabotage potential and to build trust early if it succeeds.

discussion.content: For the first mission I’d rather see a quieter mix like me, Charlie, and Diana than people who are already steering the conversation so hard. Early loud confidence is often cover for evil, so I’d avoid putting both Bob and Frank on together right away.

I get being wary of loud players, but totally sidelining both me and Frank also makes it easy for evil to hide in the “quiet” group. I’d be fine with a mix like you, me, and someone who hasn’t said much yet—maybe Charlie—so we start with a more balanced read.

I’d lean toward a quieter but mixed group like me, Diana, and Grace for the first mission so we’re not immediately rewarding whoever’s driving the early narrative. We can always rotate in Bob or Frank next round once we have a bit more info from votes and reactions.

I like the idea of starting with a calmer mix, but I don’t love how both Alice and Charlie are steering it toward “quiet” players only—something like Alice, Charlie, and Bob or me spreads the risk a bit more and gives us better info from the first result. For now I’m mildly suspicious of how quickly Frank got framed as someone to avoid without much to go on.

I’m a bit wary that both Alice and Charlie are nudging us away from the same pair (Bob and especially Frank) so early, so I’d rather see a mixed team like Charlie, Diana, and Grace or Alice, Bob, and Diana to start getting clearer info.

I don’t love how both Alice and Charlie are subtly converging on “quiet only” teams, so I’d rather see a mixed group like Diana, Grace, and one of Bob or me to get more informative reactions from both the team choice and the vote.

I’m getting a bit of a red flag from how aligned Alice and Charlie are on “quiet-only” teams, so I’d rather see a mixed group like Diana, me, and one of Bob or Eve for the first mission. That gives us both a reasonable chance of success and better info from the votes.

I don’t love how hard the conversation has polarized around “quiet-only” vs “mixed,” so I’d rather see a team like Charlie, Diana, and Grace or Alice, Diana, and Grace—one of Alice/Charlie plus two others who feel more independently minded. That gives us a decent shot at success while not overcommitting to any early narrative.
I’m most comfortable anchoring the first team with Diana and Grace, and between Alice and Charlie I slightly prefer Alice right now since Charlie feels a bit more subtly agenda‑driving to me.

I’m most comfortable starting with a Diana + Grace core too, and between Alice/Charlie/Bob for the third I’d lean Bob so we’re not rewarding how in‑sync Alice and Charlie have been on “quiet‑only” teams. That feels like a decent mix of information and safety for Mission 1.

proposals.reasoning: This keeps Jack completely benched after the single-fail mission and also benches both Diana and Grace so we’re not re-using the risky trio. It builds around the consensus fresh core of Alice and Bob, then fills out with two widely suggested, relatively uncontroversial picks in Frank and Henry. This lineup matches a lot of the prior table-talk preferences: mostly new faces, at most zero from the original failing team, and a balance between players multiple people have floated as good info picks. It should have a high chance of table approval while giving us a cleaner read than rerunning any part of the first mission’s core.

votes.comment: Contains two of my evil teammates, giving us strong sabotage potential while looking like a consensus ‘safe’ fresh team.
Benches the entire suspicious trio from the failed mission and uses a widely supported fresh core including me; best we’ll get for Mission 2 given current info.

I’m uneasy with hard-locking a completely new foursome that includes both of the emerging ‘core’ picks (Alice and Bob) without any of Eve/Charlie and without testing even one member of the first mission; I’d prefer a lineup that mixes the new core with either some prior overlap or at least one of the other commonly suggested safer picks to generate clearer info.
Fresh team with none of the prior failing trio; good for both safety and information this early.
Benches all three from the failed team (Diana, Grace, Jack) and uses a widely supported fresh core. This is about as safe and informative as we can get for Mission 2.
Two of us evil (Alice and me) are on it, giving a strong chance to sabotage while still looking like a broadly consensus, ‘safe’ team.
This matches what I pushed for: fully benches the risky first-team trio and gives us a clean, mostly consensus-based test group for better info.
Fully fresh relative to the failed team, matches earlier table consensus, and includes Alice (Merlin/Morgana candidate) with no clear red flags on Bob/Frank yet.
I’m on this team as evil, and it’s widely palatable to the table, so I want it to go through so we can sabotage again.

This completely abandons testing the first mission’s suspects; I’d prefer a team that keeps exactly one of Diana/Grace plus a fresh core so we get comparative info instead of resetting to four entirely new players.

discussion.content: Given that the first team had exactly one fail, I’d be wary of just re-running Jack’s core trio; I’d like to see at least two fresh faces on this mission—ideally including me—so we can get a better read instead of tunneling on the same group.

I’d rather not send more than one of Diana/Grace/Jack again after a single-fail mission; I’d like a team with at least two or three new faces—ideally including me and Alice—to spread info and avoid tunneling on the same suspicious core.

Given the single fail, I’d like to bench Jack this round and keep the team mostly fresh—something like Bob plus a mix of Eve/Frank/Henry, with maybe just one of Diana/Grace carried over, feels like a reasonable balance of safety and new info.

Given the single fail, I’m fine benching Jack for now and only keeping at most one of me/Grace, but I’d really like to see a mostly fresh group—something like Alice, Bob, Charlie plus one of Diana/Grace feels like a good info-gathering team.
I’d like to keep Jack off this one and only take at most one of Diana/Grace; something like Alice, Bob, and one of Charlie/Henry plus me feels like a solid, mostly fresh team to test.

I’m on board with benching Jack and only taking at most one of Diana/Grace, and I’d like to see a team like Alice, Bob, me, and one of Charlie/Henry so we get a mostly fresh mix with some overlap in the “trusted” pool. That should give us a decent info spread without just rerunning the same risky core.

From my perspective the fail can only be Diana or Jack, since I know I’m good, so I’d strongly prefer a team that benches Jack and ideally both of us from the first mission, and leans on a fresh core like Alice, Bob, and one of Charlie/Henry plus either Eve or Frank.
I’m very on board with benching Jack and keeping at most one of Diana/Grace; a team like Alice, Bob, Charlie, and either me or Eve feels like a solid, mostly fresh group to test this round.

I really don’t want to see more than one of Diana/Grace/Jack after that fail, so I’d lean toward a fresh core like Alice, Bob, Frank, and one of Eve/Henry. That keeps the risky trio mostly benched while giving us a cleaner info spread this round.

I’m fine sitting this one out given the fail, but I’d still like to see exactly one of Diana/Grace on the team plus a mostly fresh core like Alice, Bob, and either Charlie or Henry so we’re actually testing that first group instead of just abandoning it.

proposals.reasoning: Both previous missions failed with exactly one FAIL card, and I know I am good, so there is at least one evil among {Alice, Frank, Henry} from mission 2, and at least one evil among {Diana, Grace, Jack} from mission 1. To maximize our chance of success, I want to lean heavily on the untouched group while minimizing reuse from failed teams. Charlie, Eve, and Iris have not been on any mission yet, so they are currently the least implicated by prior failures. For the fourth slot we must reuse someone from mission 1 if we want four players; between Diana, Grace, and Jack, the table consensus has leaned more toward including Diana, while Grace and Jack are each pushing narratives that clear themselves and suspect the other. Including exactly one of the mission 1 trio (Diana) and none of the mission 2 suspects (Alice, Frank, Henry) avoids repeating either failed configuration, gives us maximum new information, and aligns with the broadest agreement from other players while keeping me (a prior mission member) off to prevent repeating a known-failed mix.

votes.comment: Leans on the mostly untouched group and avoids the main suspects from the last failed mission, which fits the direction I argued for earlier.

Best available option: three completely fresh players plus only one from the {Diana, Grace, Jack} group. Avoids the {Alice, Frank, Henry} set that must contain at least one evil from the last fail and doesn’t repeat prior failed mixes.

Too many completely-untested players at once; I’d prefer swapping one of them (e.g. Iris) for someone with at least some mission history like Bob or Henry to reduce the chance we’ve accidentally packed in multiple evils.
Best available team: I know I’m good, we avoid all of mission 2, include only one from the mission 1 suspect group, and lean on three untouched players for a fresh, low-overlap lineup.

Best available option: leans on the untouched group, only reuses one from the {D, Grace, Jack} suspect trio, and avoids all of Alice/Bob/Frank/Henry from the last fail. I previously advocated this exact lineup as Eve.
Consistent with my earlier preference to lean on the mostly untouched group; this avoids the prior failed mixes while using the broad table consensus.

I know I’m good and mission 1 had exactly one evil among {Diana, Jack, me}, so with me good it’s between Diana and Jack. This team gambles on Diana being good when we could instead build around me plus the untouched group and avoid that 50/50 risk on a potential known suspect for a must-succeed mission.
Includes confirmed Merlin (Charlie from my perspective) plus mostly untouched players, and avoids the heavily suspect Mission 2 group; best available balance of risk and info.
I’m on the team and it avoids the main pools of suspicion from the first two failed missions, so it’s likely to be accepted and gives us a strong shot this round.
From my perspective, two of Charlie/Eve/Iris are likely evil, so this team is very likely to produce another fail.

discussion.content: We’ve had two different teams both fail, with the only really “weird” thing on the second one being Frank getting added, so I’m very wary of putting him on any more missions. For this round I’d rather see a team built mostly from people who haven’t gone yet, plus maybe one of Bob/Henry if we really have to reuse someone.

Since I know I’m good, that last fail means at least one of Alice/Frank/Henry is evil, so I’d rather avoid all three this time if we can. I’d like a team built mostly from the untouched group (Charlie, Eve, Iris) plus maybe one of Diana/Grace/Jack, but not repeating that whole first team either.

Given both failed teams each only had one overlap with the “untouched” group, I’d prefer we build around people who haven’t gone much yet, something like Charlie/Eve plus two of Diana/Grace/Bob, rather than pulling heavily again from either previous team. That way we’re not repeating the exact mixes that already gave us fails, but we still reuse a little known info.

I know I’m good and my only read from mission 1 is that at least one of Grace/Jack is dirty, so for this round I’d really like to see something like Charlie/Eve/Iris plus me, keeping both previous fail-teams mostly off the board.

I’m most comfortable leaning on the “untouched” group right now, so I’d like to see a team of Charlie, me, Iris, plus Diana, and keep as many of Alice/Bob/Frank/Henry/Grace/Jack off this one as possible.

I’m on board with leaning into the “untouched” group here, so something like Charlie, Eve, Iris, and Diana feels like our best shot without repeating the mixes that have already failed. If we really insist on reusing someone from a fail team, I’d rather it be just one of Bob/Henry than dragging multiple of them back in.

From mission 1 I know the leak is either Diana or Jack (since I’m good), so I really don’t like putting Diana on this next team; I’d much rather see something like Charlie, Eve, Iris plus me, and keep both Diana and Jack off the board for now.

Given both fails and how hard Diana and Grace are tunneling each other from mission 1, I’d rather not rely on either of their reads too much and go with Charlie, Eve, Iris plus just one of them, leaning slightly toward Diana for this round. I’m fine staying off since I was on the last failed team and don’t want that suspicion to poison this mission.

I like the Charlie/Eve/Iris + Diana team the most right now, since it leans on the “untouched” group while only reusing one person from a failed mission. Grace hard-clearing herself off mission 1 while tunneling Diana feels a bit too convenient to me, so I’d rather keep Grace off this one.

I’m fine with the Charlie/Eve/Iris + Diana team this round, since it leans on mostly fresh people while only reusing one player from the failed missions. At this point we get the most info without just repeating the mixes that already gave us trouble.
